intro: Dortmanna gaudichaudii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and narrow, strap-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters at the tips of its stems. It is often found in coastal and wetland habitats, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Dortmanna gaudichaudii is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional Māori weaving.
